fgeo.tool 0.0.0.9003
  • Reference
  • fgeo

Reference

Read

Specific to ForestGEO

read_vft() read_taxa()

Read ViewFullTable and ViewTaxonomy files delivered by ForestGEO's database.

type_vft() type_taxa()

Help to read ForestGEO data safely, with consistent column type.

xlff_to_csv() xlff_to_xl() xlff_to_dfs()

Read and wrangle excel-FastField and output dataframes or .csv/.xlsx files.

Move data from an input to an output

General (not specific to ForestGEO)

csv_to_df() csv_to_dfs() xl_to_df() xl_to_dfs()

Read all .csv or flat excel files from a directory into dataframes.

dfs_to_csv()

Save each dataframe in a list to a different .csv file.

dfs_to_df()

Reduce a list of dataframes into a single dataframe via dplyr::full_join()

xlsheets_to_dfs()

Read one excel workbook and map each spreadsheet to a dataframe in a list.

Pick/drop rows with matching conditions

Specific to ForestGEO

drop_twice_dead()

Remove trees found dead in both the last and previous last censuses.

filter_status() drop_dead_stem() drop_dead_tree()

Filter a (fgeo) dataframe by the status of each stem or tree.

pick_main_stem()

Pick the main stem of each tree in each census.

pick_woods() pick_trees() pick_saplings() pick_saplings_and_trees()

Pick main stems within a specific dbh range.

Pick/drop rows with matching conditions

General (not specific to ForestGEO)

pick_recensus()

Identify stems to recensus.

pick_top()

Filter a data set by matching n values from the head (or tail) of a variable.

Edit data in place

Specific to ForestGEO

recode_subquad()

Recode subquadrat.

sanitize_vft() sanitize_taxa()

Sanitize ViewFullTable and ViewTaxonomy.

Edit data in place

General (not specific to ForestGEO)

convert_unit() convert_unit_at()

Convert units of a vector or columns of a dataframe.

lookup()

recode() by looking up old and new values (from a lookup table).

replace_null()

Replace literal 'NULL' (string) by NA_character_ (missing value).

standardize_at()

Divide (standardize) columns of a dataframe by a constant denominator.

Add new columns

Specific to ForestGEO

add_id()

Add a new id column to a dataframe by pasting values of preexisting columns.

add_status_tree()

Define the status of a tree based on the status of its stems.

add_subquad()

Add a quadrat variable to a dataframe based based on qx and qy coordinates.

add_lxly() add_qxqy() add_index() add_col_row() add_hectindex() add_quad() add_col_row2()

Add columns lx, ly; qx, qy; index; colrow; and hectindex to a ForestGEO dataframe.

Deal with objects' type or class

General (not specific to ForestGEO)

show_data_of_class() hide_data_of_class()

Find and hide dataset names in a package that match a class.

type_ensure()

Ensure the specific columns of a dataframe have a particular type.

Deal with objects' structure

General (not specific to ForestGEO)

nms_has_any() nms_detect() nms_extract_all() nms_extract1()

Functions to detect and extract names.

nms_extract_anycase()

Find a name exactly matching a string but regardless of case.

nms_lowercase() nms_restore()

Lower and restore names.

nms_restore_newvar()

Restore the names of a dataframe to which a new variable has been added.

nms_tidy()

Create tidy names that are lowercase and have no empty spaces.

nms_try_rename()

Try to rename an object.

by_group()

Make any function work with grouped data.

Guess

Specific to ForestGEO

extract_gridsize() extract_plotdim()

Extract plot dimensions from habitat data.

Construct S3 classes

Specific to ForestGEO

fgeo_elevation()

Construct elevation data.

fgeo_habitat()

Construct habitat data from measures of topography.

fgeo_topography()

Calculate mean elevation, convexity and slope.

Access data

Specific to ForestGEO

tool_example()

Path to directory containing example data.

Detect and flag conditions

Not specific to ForestGEO

flag_if_group() detect_if_group()

Detect and flag based on a predicate applied to a variable by groups.

Function factories

Not specific to ForestGEO

pick_woods_f()

Factory of functions to pick woods and then apply a function.

Generics

to_df(<krig_lst>)

Restructure the output of fgeo.habitat::krig() as a dataframe.

to_df()

Restructure data as a dataframe.

to_df(<tt_lst>)

Restructure the output of tt_test() as a dataframe.
